text:
Alice Sebold (born September 6, 1963) is an American writer. Her three published books are "Lucky" (1999), "The Lovely Bones" (2002) and "The Almost Moon" (2007). "Lucky" is a memoir and describes Sebold's real-life experience of rape. The bestselling "The Lovely Bones" was made into a 2009 movie. The movie was directed by Peter Jackson.
Sebold was born in Madison, Wisconsin. She married writer Glen David Gold in 2001. The couple have since divorced. She lives in San Francisco, California.
